name: watchstate
description: Watchstate is a self-hosted TV and movie tracking service that stores watch history and progress, giving an overview of what youâ€™ve seen and what is next.
features: Watch history sync: Synchronize watch progress across multiple media servers including Plex, Jellyfin, and Emby.
Multi-server support: Connect and sync watch states between different media server instances seamlessly.
Episode tracking: Automatically track which episodes you've watched and resume from where you left off.
Conflict resolution: Handle watch state conflicts intelligently when the same content is watched on different servers.
Manual adjustments: Override automatic tracking with manual episode marking for complete control.
Metadata matching: Accurately match content across servers using TMDB, TVDB, or IMDB identifiers.
Scheduled sync: Configure automatic synchronization intervals to keep watch states current without manual intervention.
Webhook support: Trigger syncs automatically when content is played using webhooks from media servers.
Dry run mode: Preview sync operations before applying changes to avoid accidental data modifications.
Detailed logging: Review sync history and troubleshoot issues with comprehensive activity logs.
Selective sync: Choose specific libraries or content types to sync while excluding others.
API access: Integrate with custom applications using the REST API for advanced automation scenarios.
